title: Difference between javascript and nodejs
body:
Javascript

1. Javascript is a high level programming language
2. It only run in browser.
3. JS can run in any browser engin.
4. JS is used in client side.
5. TypedJS is a JSframework


Node JS

1. Node JS is an interpreter and environment.
2. We can run JS outside of the browser using Node JS.
3. Node JS can run only in V8 engin.
4. It is used for server side.
5. Express is a Node JS framework.

title: When should you use nodejs and when should you use mongodb
body:
Node.js

Node.js is the best choice when want to build a real-time web application where need a process to maintain a huge connection with client and sever in real time. To create a wide range of business solutions Node JS will give advantage. To build scalable network applications Node JS is suitable.


MongoDB

MongoDB should be used when need rapid development, need to store large volume of data which may not be structured. It also can be used for cloud computing and storage.

title: Differences between sql and nosql databases.
body:
SQL database

1. SQL database is called as Relational Databases
2. SQL databases queries.
3. It is suitable for complex queries.
4. SQL database vertically Scalable
5. SQL databases follow ACID properties


NOSQL database

1. NoSQL database is called as non-relational or distributed database.
2. NoSQL database have dynamic schema
3. It is not suitable for complex queries.
4. NoSQL database horizontally scalable
5. NoSQL database follows CAP

title: What is the purpose of jwt and how does it work
body:
How JTW WORK

  1. When a user logs in to a application the server confirm the user's identity.Server create a JWT with a secret and send it to the client.
  2. The client get the JWT and store it.
  3. Then in every request the client send the JWT on request Header.
  4. When The client request a protected route , the sever check the user by using the JWT. If JWT get valid then give permission to access the route otherwise don't give access.
